image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: South Australian Police are scaling back the search for a four-year-old boy, who disappeared in the state’s mid-north almost a week ago.

title.children: Police scale back search for missing 4yo boy Gus in outback SA

image.altText: A sign outside disability support service Bedford.

props.synopsis: Australia's second-largest disability employment provider Bedford will be kept afloat by a $4.4 million federal government funding injection as it seeks a buyer for the embattled business.

title.children: More funds announced to keep Bedford afloat as hunt for buyer continues

image.altText: a picture of a river bordered by trees looking towards the horizon on a clear day.

props.synopsis: An algal bloom causing toxic foam and fish kills along South Australia's beaches prompts holiday-makers to consider alternative summer travel plans.

title.children: Holiday-makers swap the beach for the river to avoid algal bloom

image.altText: A mum wearing a pink shirt, sitting with her two children.

props.synopsis: Parents rely on after-school care to be able to participate in the workforce, but in one country SA town, the only provider's future is unclear.

title.children: After-school care closure crisis leaves parents scrambling

image.altText: Police officers standing at the door to a supermarket and scanning a man

props.synopsis: Three Adelaide shopping centres are among the latest sites where police can search for knives.

title.children: Police given powers to search for knives at three new shopping centres

image.altText: A photo of Chris Robertson whose death is being treated as murder.

props.synopsis: The death of Chris Robertson, whose body was found at an industrial site in Adelaide's south on Tuesday, is now being treated as a major crime, police say.

title.children: Murder investigation launched after father-of-two's body found at Adelaide industrial site

image.altText: Brown foam on the shores of Glenelg.

props.synopsis: Brown foam has blanketed one of the state's most popular tourist beaches in South Australia, as the state government launches an algal bloom hotline.

title.children: Foam blankets Glenelg beach as government launches algal bloom hotline

image.altText: The Adelaide CBD viewed from the air looking down on West Terrace

props.synopsis: Adelaide's lord mayor is confident the city will be prepared to host the event, even though it is 13 months away and Australia remains in a deadlock over hosting rights.

title.children: ‘We will deliver’: Adelaide defiant on COP31 despite host city delay

image.altText: A surfer balancing on a board on a wave.

props.synopsis: The disastrous algal bloom that has been lapping at South Australia's shores has turned a coastline into a frontline, leaving many swimmers, surfers and seaside business operators wondering what the upcoming summer will look like.

title.children: The sea is sick and has entered uncharted waters

image.altText: A floating structure attached to a type of bridge connecting two bodies of water in an outback area, as seen from above.

props.synopsis: A fish passage that connects the Darling River with Lake Wetherell in order to redistribute native fish is being trialled with the aim of preventing more ecological disasters.

title.children: AI deployed in bid to prevent more mass fish deaths in outback NSW

image.altText: The home of the Adelaide Lightning WNBL club.

props.synopsis: Four investors, including Drakes grocery chain owner John Paul Drake and entrepreneur Mohan Koo, have bought a 30-per-cent stake in the women's basketball team.

title.children: Adelaide Lightning bought by group of SA investors after government lifeline

image.altText: SA Police officer pointing at a screen with with a counterfeit fifty dollar note

props.synopsis: SA Police says there have been more than 200 reported cases of counterfeit currency being used in the state in the past two months.

title.children: SA Police issue fake currency warning after more than 200 incidents in past two months

image.altText: A cricket team with red caps and white shirts poses for a photo with a big trophy shield

props.synopsis: South Australia is looking to repeat its success and win the Sheffield Shield title, after a decade-breaking win last season.

title.children: SA ready to repeat drought-breaking success from last season

image.altText: An oil painting showing fields and a reaper

props.synopsis: A "rarely seen" collection of works from renowned artists Vincent van Gogh, Claude Monet and Henri Matisse will be on display in Adelaide next year, as part of 57 works on loan from the Toledo Museum of Art in the US.

title.children: Van Gogh painting to be displayed in Adelaide for first time

image.altText: A man wearing a football referee kit and holding a ball in front of goals.

props.synopsis: Bill Stephenson started refereeing to support his kids' dreams and he worries abuse will stop more like him from taking up the whistle.

title.children: Veteran junior referee retires with a message for abusive spectators

image.altText: Machester synagogue

props.synopsis: One of the victims of Thursday's attack at a synagogue in Manchester was shot by police during their attempts to bring the unarmed attacker under control.

title.children: One of Manchester attack victims reportedly killed by a bullet fired by police

image.altText: An old white man with a balding head speaks wearing a suit

props.synopsis: A Labor MP puts his party on notice after a hearing into the proposed 'Thriving Kids' autism service delivers little detail, warning that the lack of information is causing families "significant anxiety".

title.children: Labor MP says 'significant anxiety' surrounds new autism service

image.altText: Tiffany Wilkes

props.synopsis: Queensland's education minister wouldn't be drawn on reports the girl — who was found dead with her mother at an Airbnb in Kenmore Hills on Monday — had only sporadically been attending school prior to her death.

title.children: Death of 8yo in suspected murder-suicide to be reviewed by education authorities

image.altText: Sarah Mullally

props.synopsis: Sarah Mullally becomes the female leader of one of last areas of British public life to have been led by men.

title.children: First woman appointed leader of Church of England

image.altText: a man with blonde hair wearing a orange hi vis short stands in front of solar panels looking solemn

props.synopsis: The owner of a huge solar farm in outback Queensland hits the kill switch after almost a decade, saying his contract with Ergon Energy was unfair.

title.children: Owner switches off solar farm powering area twice the size of Tasmania

image.altText: Taylor Swift in a provocative outfit of jewels with red lipstick and finger in mouth.

props.synopsis: Taylor Swift's new album The Life of a Showgirl will be deconstructed by critics and fans alike, probably for some time to come. Here we get an expert Swiftie's initial reaction.

title.children: A track-by-track look at Taylor Swift's The Life of a Showgirl

image.altText: Boat involved in Bunbury accident

props.synopsis: Rescue crews have pulled a teenager with critical injuries from the water after a boating accident in Bunbury.

title.children: Teen critically injured after boat capsizes off Bunbury

image.altText: A man looks down at his phone as he walks past a white domed building

props.synopsis: While shutdowns have been a possibility since 1976, when Congress introduced the modern budget process, they've been a relatively rare occurrence. Here's a look at how previous shutdowns have played out.

title.children: What the history of US government shutdowns tells us

image.altText: A close-up photo of a man standing next to a woman with a blurred face.

props.synopsis: Como restaurateur Alberto Nicoletti is sentenced for raping a woman he offered to drive home from South Perth, his third sexual assault conviction.

title.children: Restaurateur rapist sentenced as victim reveals ongoing trauma, flashbacks

image.altText: Flotilla

props.synopsis: The Israeli military has intercepted and boarded the Marinette on Friday, believed to be the last remaining ship still sailing to Gaza as part of the Global Sumud Flotilla.

title.children: Israeli military intercepts last flotilla boat sailing to Gaza

image.altText: Hunter S Thompson

props.synopsis: A Colorado sheriff says his office wants to address lingering questions surrounding the author's death.

title.children: Review launched into death of famed journalist Hunter S Thompson

image.altText: A large crowd gathered outside the Opera House

props.synopsis: NSW Police says the location and expected scale of the rally planned by the Palestinian Action Group poses public safety concerns.

title.children: Opera House 'off-limits' as police bid to move pro-Palestinian rally

image.altText: A plane on the tarmac at night.

props.synopsis: Nearly 3,000 passengers were grounded in the latest incident in a string of drone interferences across European airports, creating heightened fears they could be linked to Russia.

title.children: Germany's Munich Airport reopens after drone sightings stop flights

image.altText: Kawhi Leonard pictured among two people at a game, full stadium behind, smoke bombs going off.

props.synopsis: Kawhi Leonard finds himself at the centre of the NBA's latest salary cap firestorm courtesy of a four-year sponsorship deal signed with a company that went bankrupt. Here's everything we know about the drama and the league's investigation.

title.children: Fraud, trees and missing millions: Kawhi Leonard and the NBA's cheating scandal

image.altText: Headshot of woman in jacket from side

props.synopsis: NT Opposition Leader Selena Uibo held a press conference on Friday to disclose the misuse, just days after travel logs were released to the ABC through Freedom of Information.

title.children: NT Labor leader misuses taxpayer-funded chauffeur service for private trips

image.altText: A bundle of leaflets held together by yellow tape. The title says Allegra Spender Exposed

props.synopsis: The Australian Electoral Commission has launched legal action against a finance executive and Wentworth constituent in relation to 47,000 unauthorised pamphlets which were distributed in the electorate during the 2025 election campaign.

title.children: Accused author of unauthorised pamphlets attacking Allegra Spender identified

image.altText: collage of document extracts layer over square colour photo of smiling female teacher and young student wearing hat

props.synopsis: Even after putting a stop to their abuser's access to students, Alliyah faced an uphill battle to get basic information about what had happened behind the scenes.

title.children: Sexual predator taught in Brisbane schools for nine years after parents' complaints

image.altText: Three in scenery

props.synopsis: In the 41 years since the first Australians summitted Mount Everest, the mountain has been transformed into a tourist attraction. Does the original magic still exist?

title.children: The 'Australian Route' up Mt Everest that may never be repeated

image.altText: A worker waters the ground in the distance while in a tunnel and a excavator works alongside them

props.synopsis: Snowy Hydro says it will need to acquire more funds to deliver the Snowy 2.0 renewable energy project, as costs continue to spiral beyond the previous $10 billion blowout.

title.children: $12 billion Snowy 2.0 project faces further cost blowouts

image.altText: A close up photo of Tony Mokbel.

props.synopsis: The drug kingpin has had a mixed result in his appeal against three convictions, with a possible retrial looming.

title.children: Gangland figure Mokbel faces retrial after spending 6,500 days in prison
